pdgm.pdgmnote: Sava2005 Tables 34,35,and 36. Here and in other paradigms,Sava’s “aorist” is noted as “aorist”. The A and B conjugations differ in the aorist,consecutive,and imprtv forms.

Pdgm = Sava2005 tables 19 and 25. Note also Table 22:Haplology in 1Pl dative pronoun:1Pl regular form is ʔine;cliticisation of =nnu gives *ʔine=nnu;reduction gives ʔi=nnu. Table 23 Syllabification of 1Sg,2SgM,and 2SgF dative pronouns:1sg *ʔee=nnu goes_to *ʔeen.nu goes_to ʔin.nu;2sg m *koo=nnu goes_to *koon.nu goes_to kun.nu;2sg f *kee=nnu goes_to *keen.nu goes_to kin.nu. Table 24:Syllabification of 1sg,2SgM,and 2SgF directive pronouns:1sg ʔee=ma goes_to ʔee.ma;2sg m koo=ma goes_to koo.ma;2sg f kee=ma goes_to kee.ma.
Sava2005 Tables 34,35,and 36. Here and in other paradigms,Sava’s “aorist” is noted as “aorist”. The A and B conjugations differ in the aorist,consecutive,and imprtv forms.

Sava2005 Tables 38-42. Sava2005,6.4.5,table 42. suffSet 5 = adjectival verbs denoting permanent states (color,size,permanent quality). Complete list,pp. 149f. See Sava,pp. 158-161 on category ‘sub’ (‘subordinate’ – here included as value of ‘pol’),occurring only with the future. ‘past’ and ‘nonPast’ occur only in the negative,and are formally related to the ‘imperf’ and ‘aorist’,respectively,of the affirmative.
Sava2005 Table 44. Table 45 gives the following rules for verbaliser-suffix + derv-suff:-aw +-as/-is goes_to -os;-aw +-aɗ goes_to -oɗ;-aw +-am goes_to -om.
Sava2005 Tables 34,35,and 36. Here and in other paradigms,Sava’s “aorist” is noted as “aorist”. The A and B conjugations differ in the aorist,consecutive,and imprtv forms.
